abstract: Paris Journal; four major bells atop northern towers of Cathedral of Notre-Dame in Paris, which have rung every 15 minutes since 1856 without fail, will be melted down and replaced by nine new ones, intended to recreate sound of Notre-Dame's original 17th-century bells; plans are causing a small but very Parisian ruckus.
snippet: The four major bells atop the northern towers of the Cathedral of Notre-Dame will be melted down and replaced by nine new ones. The plans have caused a small but very Parisian ruckus.
lead_paragraph: The four major bells atop the northern towers of the Cathedral of Notre-Dame will be melted down and replaced by nine new ones. The plans have caused a small but very Parisian ruckus.

headline.main: A Melodic Emblem Falls Out of Tune
headline.seo: In Paris, Bells at Notre Dame Will Be Replaced
headline.print_headline: A Melodic Emblem Falls Out of Tune
